question: What happened to Juno Cloud instances in the non-High Availability zone during the June 6, 2025 outage?
answer: Cloud instances in the Juno Cloud (non-High Availability zone) were shut down.

question: What was the status of jobs scheduled to complete after 9:00 a.m. on June 6 during the outage?
answer: Jobs scheduled to finish after 9:00 a.m. on June 6 remained queued until the clusters were back online.

question: Which cloud instances experienced short access outages during the June 6, 2025 maintenance?
answer: Cloud instances on Béluga Cloud and in the Juno Cloud HA zone experienced short access outages.

question: Were storage systems on Béluga and Narval accessible during the June 6, 2025 maintenance?
answer: Storage systems on Béluga and Narval remained accessible via Globus and login nodes but saw intermittent disruptions due to the work.

question: When was the scheduled electrical maintenance for Béluga and Narval compute nodes in April/May 2025?
answer: Scheduled electrical maintenance required the shutdown of Béluga and Narval compute nodes from 12:00 PM (EDT) on April 30 until 12:00 PM (EDT) on May 1, 2025.

question: What was the impact on Juno cloud instances in the non-high availability zone during the April 30, 2025 outage?
answer: Cloud instances in the Juno cloud (non-high availability zone) were also shut down during this time.

question: Were Béluga cloud instances affected by the April 30, 2025 maintenance?
answer: These interruptions did not affect Béluga cloud instances or Juno cloud instances in the high availability zone.

question: How could users access Béluga and Narval storage during the April 30, 2025 outage?
answer: Béluga and Narval storage remained accessible through Globus and the login nodes of each cluster.

question: What was the reason for the Cedar cluster outage from March 31 to April 2, 2025?
answer: A planned outage was required to perform power modifications as part of the preparations for bringing new equipment online.

question: What happened to jobs running on the Cedar cluster during the March 31, 2025 outage?
answer: Any jobs running at the time of the outage were terminated and had to be re-submitted once the cluster came back online.

question: Was Cedar Cloud operational during the March 31, 2025 outage?
answer: Cedar Cloud remained operational during this period.

question: Could users log in to the Cedar cluster during the March 31, 2025 outage?
answer: The Cedar cluster was completely unavailable during this time, and users were not able to log in or run jobs on the cluster.

question: What was the reason for the Graham cluster outage starting December 7, 2024?
answer: Ongoing renovations require a complete data center shutdown.

question: What was the original duration of the Graham cluster shutdown in December 2024?
answer: The outage was originally scheduled from Dec 7, 2024 to Jan 3, 2025.

question: Was Graham cloud services available during the December 7, 2024 outage?
answer: All Graham cluster services, storage, and cloud services will be entirely unavailable.

question: What was the updated end date for the Graham outage that started on December 7, 2024?
answer: The outage was extended to February 24, 2025.

question: Why were Béluga and Narval compute nodes temporarily reduced in capacity starting January 13, 2025?
answer: Performance and stability tests on Rorqual required the shutdown of all Béluga compute nodes and about half of Narval compute nodes.

question: Which compute nodes were affected during the January 13, 2025 temporary reduction?
answer: All Béluga compute nodes and about half of Narval compute nodes were shut down.

question: What was the impact on Narval's node categories during the January 13, 2025 reduction?
answer: On Narval, approximately 50% of nodes from each category (CPU, GPU, and large memory) were shut down.

question: What happened to Béluga Storage during the January 13, 2025 shutdown?
answer: Béluga Storage was mounted to Narval (/lustre01, /lustre02, /lustre03, /lustre04 of Beluga).

question: Were Béluga and Juno cloud instances affected by the January 13, 2025 temporary reduction?
answer: Béluga and Juno cloud instances are unaffected.

question: What was the expected recovery date for Béluga and Narval to return to 100% capacity after the January 13, 2025 reduction?
answer: Béluga and Narval should be back to 100% capacity on February 14.

question: When were Niagara and Mist compute nodes shut down on January 22, 2025?
answer: Niagara and Mist compute nodes were shut down on January 22, 2025 from 8 AM to 5 PM EST.

question: What was the purpose of the Niagara and Mist compute node shutdown on January 22, 2025?
answer: The shutdown was to support ongoing system improvements and the integration with the new system, Trillium.

question: Which services remained available during the Niagara and Mist outage on January 22, 2025?
answer: The login nodes, file systems, and the HPSS system will remain available.

question: What was the reason for the Cedar compute cluster shutdown from January 13 to January 21, 2025?
answer: The Cedar compute cluster will be shut down in preparation for the infrastructure renewal.

question: What action was recommended for users regarding their /scratch filesystem data during the January 13, 2025 Cedar outage?
answer: Users were advised to move any important data immediately to their /project, /nearline, or /home directory.

question: Was Cedar cloud functional during the January 13, 2025 outage?
answer: Cedar cloud will remain operational during this period.

question: What was the reason for the Niagara outage on November 25-26, 2024?
answer: A full power shutdown took place for main panel upgrades ahead of Trillium cluster setup.

question: What happened to jobs during the Niagara outage on November 25, 2024?
answer: The scheduler will hold jobs that cannot finish before the start of the shutdown.

question: What advice was given to users regarding job submission before the November 25, 2024 Niagara maintenance?
answer: Users are encouraged to submit smaller, short-duration jobs to optimize idle node usage before the maintenance begins.

question: Which systems at the SciNet Datacenter were unavailable on November 7-8, 2024?
answer: All systems and storage at the SciNet Datacenter (Niagara, Mist, HPSS, Rouge, Teach, JupyterHub, Balam) will be unavailable.

question: What was the duration of the SciNet Datacenter outage on November 7, 2024?
answer: The systems were unavailable from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. ET.

question: Why was the SciNet Datacenter outage necessary on November 7, 2024?
answer: This outage is necessary for installing new electrical equipment (UPS) as part of a systems refresh.

question: Which Cedar services were unaffected by the November 7, 2024 outage?
answer: Cedar login nodes, storage, and cloud services will remain operational and unaffected.

question: What was the impact on Cedar compute nodes during the November 7, 2024 outage?
answer: Cedar compute nodes will be unavailable during this period.
